intro: Eriocaulon spadiceum, commonly known as the spike rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its triangular stems and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and pond margins, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, scale-like leaves are tightly packed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Eriocaulon spadiceum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
